refnamediv.refpurpose: Configurable slider controls for realtime user input.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Configurable slider controls for realtime user input. Requires Winsound or TCL/TK. setctrl sets a slider to a specific value, or sets a minimum or maximum range.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: Note that this opcode is not available on Windows due to the implimentation of pipes on that system
inum -- number of the slider to set
ival -- value to be sent to the slider

itype -- type of value sent to the slider as follows:
1 -- set the current value. Initial value is 0.
2 -- set the minimum value. Default is 0.
3 -- set the maximum value. Default is 127.
4 -- set the label. (New in Csound version 4.09)

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: Calling setctrl will create a new slider on the screen. There is no theoretical limit to the number of sliders. Windows and TCL/TK use only integers for slider values, so the values may need rescaling. GUIs usually pass values at a fairly slow rate, so it may be advisable to pass the output of control through port.
